title: Dorset & Hants Live: WW2 bomb found in Portsmouth - BBC News
summary: portsmouth evacuation zone lifted after ww2 bomb towed out to sea .
former saints footballer granted freedom of the city later .
first dorset bus drivers begin new 24-hour strike .
non-league eastleigh stun league one swindon with 3-1 fa cup win .

documents.title: murder accused 'attacked sleeping partner '
text: a woman accused of murdering her partner by stabbing him in the back at his home in ryde had previously attacked him with a hammer while he was sleeping , a court has heard .
the jury heard the victim , jolyon wray , 46 , told his brother how deborah napier hit him three times with a hammer causing a head injury .
luke wray told winchester crown court his brother had refused to marry mrs napier and wanted to end the relationship .
mrs napier , 53 , of amazon close , basingstoke , has admitted the manslaughter of her partner on 13 june , but denies murder , and the trial continues .

documents.title: watch : benali 'humbled ' by freedom of southampton honour
text: watch : benali 'humbled ' by freedom of southampton honour

documents.title: weather outlook : cold and showery
text: a cold night with a brisk westerly wind .
although the evening will begin dry showers will move in and become more widespread by dawn .
lows of about 8c ( 46f ) .
tomorrow will also be cold , windy and unsettled .
the rain will become heavy at times with a risk of hail and thunder .
highs of about 12c ( 53f ) .
for a full 10-day forecast , visit the bbc weather site .

documents.title: francis benali receives the freedom of southampton
text: francis benali receives the freedom of southampton

documents.title: breakingtwelve clubs fined for efl trophy breaches
text: breakingtwelve clubs fined for efl trophy breaches

documents.title: arrest over 'attempted murder ' outside southampton pub
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempting to murder a 48-year-old man who was found with serious injuries to his hands and head near a southampton pub .
the victim was found outside the angel pub on palmerston road just after 02:20 this morning .
he was taken to hospital with serious but not life threatening injuries .
a 26-year-old man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder and remains in police custody .

documents.title: hmp winchester inmates 'locked up 23 hours a day '
text: some inmates at a prison in hampshire are spending as little as 45 minutes out of their cells a day , a watchdog has said .
a restricted daily routine had been operating for many months in the victorian part of hmp winchester at the time of an inspection in july .
this was `` mainly owing to problems with staffing levels and supervision '' , the hm inspectorate of prisons report said .
it also found inmates often spent more than 24 hours locked up at weekends .

documents.title: breakingww2 bomb detonated off isle of wight
text: the bomb that caused so much disruption in portsmouth today has finally been detonated .
royal navy experts carried out a controlled explosion 1.5 miles east of the isle of wight .

documents.title: soldier who served in afghanistan has medal stolen
text: a soldier who served in afghanistan is appealing for help after his medal was stolen in southampton .
police are investigating after the medal , which recognises the british soldier 's service in the country , was stolen from a vehicle .
the medal is silver and engraved and was stolen in charlton road overnight on saturday .

text: # portsmouth council leader remains hopeful city can stage tour de france read more at :

documents.title: 'no sheep driving through southampton ' for benali
text: the honorary freedom of the city awarded to former southampton player francis benali confers no rights or privileges , such as driving sheep through the city , and is `` purely ceremonial '' , the council has said .

it was officially granted to the 47-year-old earlier in recognition of his fundraising achievements for charitable causes , as well those as a player and coach at saints , southampton city council added .

documents.title: ex-footballer granted freedom of southampton
text: former southampton legend francis benali , who ran and cycled to every premier league and championship stadium in two weeks , has been granted the freedom of the city .
the defender , who made more than 300 appearances for the club , ran a marathon and cycled 75 miles ( 120km ) each day for a fortnight in october .
the city council unanimously approved a motion giving him honorary freedom of the city at a special meeting earlier .
the 47-year-old described receiving the honour as `` a complete surprise '' .

documents.title: portsmouth returns to normal after evacuation
text: it seems life in the city is getting back to normal after the dramatic ww2 bomb find this morning .
we 'll bring you the latest news as we get it but we 'll be returning to our usual coverage across hampshire , the isle of wight and dorset .

documents.title: bomb safely towed away from portsmouth
text: police have confirmed that the wartime bomb has been safely towed from portsmouth harbour .
the 300m cordon placed around gunwharf and old portsmouth has been lifted .

documents.title: ferry service to resume
text: it would appear the unexploded 500lb ww2 bomb has been towed far enough away from portsmouth for services to resume in the city .
gunwharf quays shopping centre has reopened while wightlink ferries has resumed sailings .
p-f car ferry : we are just about to resume service .
we expect delays of around 2 hours , operating on a first come first served shuttle basis

documents.title: breakingportsmouth shopping centre reopens
text: we have now reopened .
huge apologies for all of the inconvenience caused today .

documents.title: portsmouth harbour closed as device moved
text: the royal navy says the 500lb ww2 bomb is being towed further out into the harbour , which will be closed to ferry traffic for up to an hour as the device passes .
a controlled explosion 1.5 miles off the eastern isle of wight will be carried out either later today or early tomorrow .
author: Michael Stoddard
BBC News, South

documents.title: shopping centre wo n't open until at least 2.30pm

the only update we have is that it will be closed for at least another 40 minutes .

sorry it was @ twitterid
we allowed people to get their cars until the device was in a close vicinity at which case we had to totally lock down .
apologies .

documents.title: unexploded ww2 bomb to be towed away from city
text: we had been told by travel companies that the unexploded ww2 bomb in portsmouth harbour was being towed to a safer place .
but it appears the device has yet to be moved with experts due to deal with it shortly .
author: Michael Stoddard
BBC News, South

documents.title: road closures across portsmouth because of bomb discovery
text: police have announced other parts of portsmouth which have been closed as royal navy experts prepare to safely dispose of the wartime bomb discovered this morning .
areas currently closed include tower alley , bath square , west street , the camber and the hot walls area .
the hard , including portsmouth harbour station and the gosport ferry and the clarence pier area and long curtain moat car park and footpaths are also shut .
road closures are also in force in bath square , west street , broad street and tower street .

documents.title: ferry company cancels all services over ww2 bomb
text: info | clipper all services have been cancelled today , 16th november 2016.please see for more info .

documents.title: woman 'killed partner during 999 call '
text: a woman fatally stabbed her partner during a 999 call to the police , winchester crown court has heard .
the prosecution said deborah napier admitted stabbing jolyon wray , 46 , in the back at his flat in east hill road , ryde , on 13 june , while a 999 operator was listening .
the pair were in a violent and destructive relationship `` blighted by alcohol '' , the court heard .
mrs napier , 53 , of amazon close , basingstoke , has admitted manslaughter but denies murder , and the trial continues .
author: Marcus White
BBC News

documents.title: hunt for man who stole handbag from bottom of pram
text: police are searching for this man after a spate of thefts in totton .
the man was seen just before 17:00 gmt on saturday at tesco express in watson walk , where he leaned towards the counter and took £ 20 from a member of staff .
he then ran out of the store .
a short time later the man entered west totton community centre in hazel farm road .
he stole a black versace handbag worth £ 60 from the bottom of a pram which contained baby changing items .

documents.title: historic dockyard managers hope to re-open tomorrow
text: # portsmouth harbour bomb alert : historic dockyard managers hope to reopen tomorrow

documents.title: railway line closed because of wartime bomb
text: the line is closed between portsmouth harbour and fratton because of a wartime bomb near the railway
disruption caused by an unexploded wartime bomb between portsmouth harbour and fratton has ended .
train services are returning to schedule .
thats what they thought at newport gwent

documents.title: wightlink ferries affected after wartime bomb discovery
text: wightlink ferry services are now being affected by the discovery of a wartime bomb in portsmouth .
the portsmouth-fishbourne and portsmouth harbour-ryde pier head services will be delayed .
the 11:47 wightlink catamaran service from ryde pier head to portsmouth harbour is returning to ryde with its customers .
st cecilia , the 12:00 car ferry sailing from portsmouth , sailed to fishbourne as normal but st clare , the 12:00 sailing from fishbourne has not left the isle of wight .

documents.title: knives sold to children in southampton
text: six out of 10 stores sold knives to children during test-purchase operations in southampton , police have revealed .
a large axe was sold to a 16-year-old at one store , while another failed by selling a box of kitchen knives to a 16-year-old .
it is an offence under the criminal justice act 1988 to sell knives to under-18s .
the 10 tests were carried by police and city council trading standards teams .

documents.title: breakinggunwharf quays evacuated 'with immediate effect '
text: due to a world war 2 device being moved out of the harbour , we need to evacuate our centre with immediate effect .
we will update on twitter

if you are on site , please collect your car so that you can leave the site .
if you are offsite , you can not return at this time .
we asked about getting the car when we were evacuated and were told to leave the site
hi kate , i have now had confirmation that you can collect your car from the car park and leave the site .
many thanks .

documents.title: man charged with poppy collections thefts
text: a man has been charged with the theft of royal british legion poppy appeal collection boxes in poole and hampshire .
the 49-year-old man , of no fixed abode , will appear at bournemouth magistrates ' court today .
he is charged with seven counts of theft of collection boxes , two counts of theft from a shop and two counts of fraud by false representation .
the alleged incidents happened between october and november .

documents.title: police begin to evacuate areas across portsmouth ahead of bomb disposal
text: police have confirmed that evacuation will start at midday after the discovery of an unexploded bomb in portsmouth .
officers from hampshire constabulary will begin the evacuation of both the shopping and residential areas of gunwharf quays .
those evacuated from the gunwharf quays area will be directed to the john pound centre , in queen street , one of two rest centres set up .
the other is at portsmouth cathedral .
other areas being evacuated will include the wightlink terminal , old portsmouth , portsmouth harbour station , gosport ferry station and the hot walls areas .

documents.title: brittany ferries now allowed to enter portsmouth port
text: three brittany ferries have now been allowed to enter portsmouth port .
a spokeswoman has confirmed that under direction of queen 's harbour master the normandie , bretagne and cap finistère will be coming to dock in the harbour .
the company has now decided to cancel its 08:15 normandy to caen service and the 11:45 cap finistère to bilbao .
passengers have been transferred to overnight sailings this evening or given a full refund .

documents.title: your passenger stuck on portsmouth-bound ferry
text: brittany ferries passenger zoё grisedale has shared some images on board the normandie ferry as it waits to dock in portsmouth .

documents.title: first ferry given permission to berth in portsmouth after bomb find
text: condor ferries have confirmed they have been given permission to enter the port .
commodore clipper was hovering outside portsmouth harbour with 94 passengers on board .
the ferry is now making its way to the berth where passengers will be able to disembark .

documents.title: bomb moved away from harbour and port temporarily reopened
text: the royal navy has confirmed that the unexploded bomb has now been safely moved further into portsmouth harbour .
a statement released said that the continental port has been temporarily reopened and the plan is to tow the bomb out of the harbour later today when tidal conditions allow .

documents.title: passengers react to news they are stuck on board ferries after bomb discovery

documents.title: fire crews tackle blaze on weymouth lifeboat
text: # weymouth fire and # rnli crews early actions helped bring a fire on board the lifeboat to quick and safe conclusion .

documents.title: man chases victim down the road
text: a man has been chased down the road by another man who was threatening to kill him .
police are investigating after the victim , a man in his 20s , was chased down north road in poole on monday at about 14:30 gmt .
an unknown man in a black seven-seated vehicle then up the victim and took him to branksome train station .
a 21-year-old man was arrested on sus of threats to kill and has been bailed until january .

documents.title: hundreds of passengers stuck on ferries after unexploded bomb found in portsmouth
text: brittany ferries has revealed they have 950 passengers waiting on board three ferries .
the ships have been delayed and are hovering outside portsmouth harbour after an unexploded bomb was discovered .
a spokeswoman said passengers and customers waiting in the departures lounge were all being given refreshments .

documents.title: bomb is third found since dredging works started
text: this is the third piece of historic ordnance found in the harbour during the dredging works since september .
again we are working with hampshire police to ensure we deal with this incident in the safest way possible , at the same time causing least disruption to the city .

documents.title: naval bomb disposal experts waiting to destroy dockyard discovery
text: royal navy bomb disposal experts are waiting to move an unexploded german world war two bomb off the portsmouth coast .
the device was found at 05:00 this morning by a barge dredging the harbour ahead of the arrival next spring of hms queen elizabeth .
some naval base employees have been moved to buildings outside the cordon and a plan is in place to tow it out of the harbour to destroy it off the eastern coast of the isle of wight .
the timing is dependent on tidal times and conditions .

documents.title: portsmouth historic dockyard closed all day
text: dockyard staff have announced they will be closed all day after the discovery of an unexploded bomb .
the dockyard has been cordoned off since the discovery early this morning of a world war two bomb and will not be open to visitors today .
updated statement regarding discovery of ww2 bomb found in # portsmouth harbour .
we will be closed today wed 16 nov

documents.title: bomb discovered by dredging barge
text: the latest statement from portsmouth historic dockyard
a 500m cordon is in place around the device .
a plan is in place to tow the bomb out of the harbour where it will be destroyed in open waters by navy bomb disposal experts .
the device was found by a dredging barge carrying out work in the harbour before the arrival of hms queen elizabeth - the navy 's new 65,000-tonne aircraft carrier .

documents.title: commodore clipper hovering outside portsmouth harbour after ww2 bomb discovery
text: the commodore clipper ferry has also been delayed by the unexploded bomb in portsmouth .
the condor ferry is currently hovering outside portsmouth harbour .

documents.title: m27 reopens after crash vehicles moved to hard shoulder
text: all lanes are now open on the # m27 westbound btwn j4 ( # m3 ) - j3 ( # m271 ) .
long delays remain but should start to ease now .

documents.title: bomb to be towed off the coast for controlled explosion
text: officials at portsmouth historic dockyard have said a bomb found in portsmouth harbour will `` likely '' be towed out for a controlled explosion .
breaking : portsmouth harbour closed after explosive device found - bomb squad on scene
@ bestmysong it 's a ww2 bomb - will likely be towed out of harbour and controlled explosion off the coast as per usual procedure

documents.title: torch-lit vigil held for teenage runners
text: torch-lit vigil held for teenage runners

documents.title: three ships delayed by bomb discovery in portsmouth
text: three ships have been delayed after an unexploded bomb was discovered in portsmouth harbour .
brittany ferries has confirmed two vessels from france and one from spain have been affected after the discovery of the bomb .
the normandie ferry was scheduled to arrive from caen at 06:45 , the bretagne was expected at 07:45 from st malo and the finistere ferry was scheduled for 09:00 from bilbao .
bosses are expecting delays all day for arrivals and departures.they have apologised to customers for any inconvenience caused .
a spokeswoman said they were currently waiting to find out the timescale for removing the bomb .
services to and from portsmouth are subject to delays .
unexploded ordnance found during dredging .
latest updates
bang goes the timetable then ( no pun intended ) .
hope the vessels get in soon cj .

documents.title: weather alert for train passengers this week
text: south west trains has announced a weather alert this week .
strong gusts of wind are currently affecting services between london waterloo and weymouth with delays expected this morning .
# weatherswt- weather alert from tuesday to sunday this week , please check before you travel

text: discovery of ww2 bomb found in # portsmouth harbour .
we are currently cordoned and not open to visitors .
updates

documents.title: swindon town 1-3 eastleigh
text: swindon town 1-3 eastleigh

documents.title: hospital merger 'back on the cards ' in dorset
text: hospital merger 'likely ' amid 'greatest financial crisis ' in history of nhs

documents.title: ww2 bomb in portsmouth prompts exclusion zone
text: a world war two german bomb has been found by a dredging barge on the seabed in portsmouth harbour .
an exclusion zone has been set up in the sea which is preventing cross-channel ferries from entering and leaving the ferry port .
victory gate has also been closed to pedestrians .

documents.title: former saints footballer benali set to be given freedom of the city
text: a vote will be held later on a motion to grant former southampton footballer francis benali the freedom of the city

the 47-year-old , who made more than 300 appearances for southampton fc , ran a marathon and cycled 75 miles ( 120km ) each day for a fortnight last month to visit every premier league and championship stadium .
the challenge raised more than £ 390,000 for cancer research .
southampton city council will vote on the motion at a special meeting this afternoon .
the authority proposes bestowing the honor on benali `` in recognition of his fundraising achievements for charitable causes '' .

documents.title: first dorset bus drivers begin new 24-hour strike
text: bus drivers in dorset have begun a new 24-hour strike in a five-month dispute over pay .
members of the unite union in weymouth and bridport voted to turn down the latest pay offer from first dorset earlier this month .
the latest walk-out began at 04:30 gmt with lines assembling from 07:00 .
first dorset said some routes including the lyme regis to exeter service would not be running .

documents.title: latest sport headlines : eastleigh in stunning fa cup win
text: latest sport headlines : eastleigh in stunning fa cup win

documents.title: weather : cloudy with outbreaks of rain , then becoming breezy
text: this morning will be dry at first with bright or sunny spells .
outbreaks of rain will spread down from the north by midday though .
there 'll be gusty winds throughout the day too .
highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
it will become noticeably cooler tonight as patchy rain clears southwards .
it should stay dry for most overnight and the strong winds will keep a frost at bay .
minimum temperatures of 6c ( 43f ) .

documents.title: latest headlines : woman not guilty of 'demon ' murder bid
text: latest headlines : woman not guilty of 'demon ' murder bid

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc local live for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight on wednesday .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news from across the three counties .
you can get in touch by email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ twitterid and @ twitterid
